name: Piccolo Hotel

reviews.text: My mother, daughter and I stayed at the Piccolo in Florence. We wanted a triple room which we had. It was bigger than any other triples in Europe that we had the previous nights. It was very clean and airy. It has air-conditioning that works which we found unique in Italy!.. Silvia and her staff are excellent. We felt like family. Prior to our arrival Silvia had sent me things to do in Florence. Our favaorite was a Tuscan cooking class and second the wine tasting tour. She had all of our tickets on our arrival and mapped everything out for us. The stay includes breakfast with great "Americano coffee", pastries, juice, and cereal. It was all we needed until dinner. There also was an excellent restaurant just a couple of doors down from the hotel. We were within walking distance of the Duamo and we were only two blocks from " The David". We certainly enjoyed our stay in Florence.
reviews.title: Piccolo is Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great suprise; the staff was VERY VERY good and informative; rooms are exactly as described, if not better, and all for the price of just a bit more than a hostel (my partner and I stayed together .... a hostel double would have cost about the same, andwe had + + privacy, quiet and our own washroom). Rooms are very clean and well kept. Our room had a beautiful view out of our doors of a small garden. Hotel is within walking distance form most great attractions, just watch over-charging at the train station .. the hotel is not that far to walk and should not cost over 5€ .. our taxi ripped us off, but this had nothing to do with the hotel. The hotel is i a residential area that we found great, as you can be around REAL Florenteens and students, so you get a real taste of life in Florence. Our stay was SO good we stayed an extra night. Well done, Piccolo & thank you!!
reviews.title: highly recommended!!!!

reviews.text: Overall we were very happy with our experience at the Piccolo. It wasn't luxurious but we were not expecting that for the price. The place was kept up very nice, it was clean and they were extremely helpful & welcoming, what more could you ask for!
reviews.title: Great location & Price
Passionate about the Piccolo
reviews.text: The location is great and there was an adequate breakfast each morning. We really enjoyed our stay there and would definitely recommend it to others.

reviews.title: The Piccolo's Great!!!
reviews.text: Just had 6 dreamy days in beautiful Florence and we stayed in a really lovely hotel: the Piccolo on Via S. Gallo, which is really near the historic centre. I would totally recommend this place to anyone planning a trip to Florence (and if you're not, then plan one now!). It's a charming and comfortable little hotel run by the nicest people, especially the owner who was really helpful with where to go and what to see. It's very close to most of the attractions and it's surrounded by some very good shops, restaurants, bars and (of course) trattorias! We had a great time.

reviews.title: Free bike rides and friendly service.
reviews.text: Our stay at the Piccolo was wonderful. The rooms are spacious, clean, and simple. But what makes the hotel a great choice are the little things the hotel offers that most do not. First of all, the hotel is in a great location. It is close to all of the shopping and the Duomo. Second, the hotel offers free bicycle usage to its guests. Florence is great on foot, but having a bicycle while exploring the sights was fantastic. Finally, the service is first rate... the small staff is friendly, outgoing, and personable (and very knowledgeable). The hotel is quite inexpensive, and when you factor in the quality of service and the bicycles, it is a great value! We will stay here again. Highly recommended.
The Piccolo Hotel is well located about 10 minutes' walk from the Duomo. (Don't bring your car to the hotel - its in the historic centre and you'll get a fine, and anyway there's no parking there).
reviews.title: Good location - small hotel - not bad
hideous!!!!
reviews.text: This place is absolutely horrendous, unkempt, uncomfortable and unwelcoming. I booked into this 'hotel' after reading the other reviews on here but checked out the same evening after managing to obtain a much better hotel for not much more money. I still had to pay for a nights accomodation even though I did not stay, there were no questions asked as to why I was leaving, I would guess this happens a lot. I cannot understand why anyone would stay here of there own free will it is absolutely hideous!

reviews.title: What a wonderful experience
reviews.text: When we visited, it was low season in Florence. Only owner serviced us. She is very kind and extremely helpful(she provide useful advice whenever we have any question about trip). We even changed our travel plan and extended one more night.
Room is big and clean. It is only a 10 minute walk to the train station. Besides, rate is reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...
Great Place
reviews.text: My family recently stayed at the Piccolo hotel for 3 nights. Our room was very large and clean. While it had nice wood laminate floors, they were very loud. Whenever anyone walked up the stairs or opened/closed their door, our door shook and it was very, very loud - the floors just echoed the noice. Other than that the hotel was great and the staff was very friendly. The location was nice as it was walking distance to nearly everything - even with a 5 year old. For a nice hotel at a reasonable price - pack your earplugs and enjoy!

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: You would never know that hiding behind a little sign and past a dingy hallway with rope lifts would be such a little gem. What character! The Piccolo is small & cozy & full of warmth, hospitality, & charm. From the friendly advice we recieved from emails even before our trip, to the large clean rooms, to the quaint breakfast each am we were so impressed. The staff was very helpful, even when it came to them making numerous phone calls for us when we left our laundry at the cleaners that was not to open again until after we left Florence. (We really should know a little more Italian!) I felt as though we were staying at a distant relative's home instead of a hotel! Have a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was terrible! The room was clean but it smelt. You could not open the windows to air the room because of the mosquito's. The toilet was in the shower. The manager was rude and unhelpful.
reviews.title: Terrible!

reviews.text: Be sure to read all of the reviews! When I booked, most of the reviews were positive, but now I am seeing more reviews with similar comments.
reviews.title: Good, but not the best

likes.liked: — Great location to some sites, short walk

reviews.title: Small and charming
reviews.text: I should have guessed by the name of the hotel....Piccolo....doesn' that mean small in Italian?
My recommendation is for only a few euros more a day, stay in a place where you can enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Worst hotel

likes.liked: — Walking distance to centre of Florence

reviews.text: We booked a room at this hotel and it was nice and comfortable, with a view into a nice courtyard area. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was nice, even though early so difficult to get up for. The breakfast room was nice and large. The males at the location were much friendlier than the females, even helping us with my friends overweight luggage. Overall it was nice, but we had some really nice stays other places so our expectation level was a bit high. Also, the 2 flights of stairs were a bummer after having only one small flight in Rome.
reviews.title: The Piccolo Hotel, small and friendly....

likes.liked: — proximity to the Galleria Accademia and the manager
likes.disliked: — somewhat dated decor, however the cost is kept reasonable as a result

description: The Hotel Piccolo is located in the center of Florence,in the very characteristic district of San Lorenzo, full of particular and Florentine shops and with a nice open market. Thanks to the central location, you can easily walk to the most important museums like the Galleria dell'Accademia, known for the David by Michelangelo, the Galleria degli Uffizi and keep walking to Piazza della Signoria, where Palazzo Vecchio is.
